DOCNAME: CASE OF JAFARLI AND OTHERS v. AZERBAIJAN
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible
JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants were members of a cooperative ( “ Əlincə ” PERSON – “ the NORP ” ) incorporated in GPE . The ORG was created by a decision of a general meeting of DATE and was initially composed of CARDINAL members , including the first applicant .

CARDINAL . The ORG 's charter was officially registered on DATE by ORG of GPE . According to this charter , the ORG was to be liquidated , inter alia , if the number of its members dropped to CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . According to TIME of the ORG 's general meetings available in the case file , there were subsequently some changes in the membership of the ORG . Following the departure of CARDINAL members of the ORG , on DATE the second and third applicants became its new members and the total number of the members amounted to CARDINAL . In all these documents the first applicant was mentioned as the chairman of the ORG .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to a number of contracts concluded in DATE , the ORG supplied CARDINAL of the units of ORG of Border Troops of ORG ( “ ORG ” ) with various foodstuffs .
CARDINAL . Although the ORG had fulfilled its contractual obligations , it was not fully paid .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG brought an action against ORG and ORG No . DATE , asking for payment of an accrued debt in the amount of CARDINAL old NORP manats ( ORG PERCENT interest , as stipulated by the contract .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG No . CARDINAL dismissed the claim against ORG . However , ORG No . CARDINAL upheld the claim against ORG No . DATE and ordered the latter to pay AZM CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL in total to the ORG . This amount included the principal debt of NORP and the penalty charge of GPE .
CARDINAL . No appeals were lodged against that judgment and , pursuant to the domestic law , it became enforceable within DATE of its delivery .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG No . CARDINAL issued a writ of execution of the judgment . However , ORG No . DATE refused to comply with the judgment and , despite the applicants ' complaints to various authorities , it was not enforced .
CARDINAL . In the meantime the Department of Border Troops was reorganised and renamed as ORG .

CARDINAL . The documents in the case file show that , on the basis of a request by the ORG dated DATE , signed by the first applicant , the ORG 's activity as a taxpayer was ceased and this fact was recorded by ORG .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the ORG brought an action against ORG and ORG complaining about the non - enforcement of the judgment of DATE . The ORG claimed CARDINAL for lost earnings , ORG CARDINAL for material damage and CARDINAL for non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG No . CARDINAL dismissed the claim , finding that neither of the defendants could be held responsible for the non - enforcement of the judgment , because the amount awarded to the ORG by the judgment of DATE had not been paid due to the refusal of ORG to allocate state funds for this purpose .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG and on DATE ORG upheld the first - instance court 's judgment .
CARDINAL . In the period from DATE , the judgment of DATE was fully executed and the total amount of GPE DATE was paid into the bank account that the ORG held at ORG .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE terminated the enforcement proceedings owing to the execution of the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . The Law on Cooperation in the GPE of CARDINAL DATE of the GPE provided that a cooperative was established on a voluntary basis . The number of members of a cooperative could not be CARDINAL ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The PERSON of DATE on the temporary remaining in force of former GPE laws on the territory of GPE and their application provided a list of former GPE laws which would remain in force in GPE until the relevant laws of GPE were adopted . LAW in the GPE of CARDINAL DATE appeared on this list . This PERSON ceased to apply on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Civil Code of DATE provides that a cooperative is a type of commercial company which is a voluntary union of individuals or legal entities established for the purpose of satisfying material and other needs of its members through consolidation of their material contributions ( Article CARDINAL ) . A cooperative can be established by CARDINAL members ( Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Members of a cooperative , in essence , enjoy rights similar to those of founders or shareholders of other types of legal entities , including the right to participate in the management of the cooperative and to receive a share of its profits ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL in fine ) . The cooperative 's property is divided among the members in accordance with its charter ( LAW . The cooperative 's profits are distributed to the members in accordance with their shares , as well as the extent of their participation in the function of the cooperative , by way of contributing personal labour or otherwise ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . The supreme management body of a cooperative is the general meeting of members . Each member has CARDINAL vote at the general meeting regardless of the size of his or her contribution to the cooperative 's capital fund ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The executive bodies of a cooperative are a management board and/or a chairman . A cooperative 's chairman may only be elected from among the cooperative 's members . The chairman is elected for a specified term at the general meeting of members and has the right to represent the cooperative ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . A cooperative may be voluntarily reorganised or liquidated by a decision of its members ' general meeting ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW provides that legal entities can be represented before courts by their bodies , acting within the scope of powers conferred on them by law , regulations or constitutive documents of the legal entity , or by representatives acting on the basis of a power of attorney .
